message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CR, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.DS 

The paper deals with the problem of robustness in machine learning, specifically in the context of classifiers generated by input randomization. This topic is relevant to several sub-fields of computer science, including machine learning (cs.LG), cryptography (cs.CR), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), computer vision (cs.CV), and data structures and algorithms (cs.DS). Given the focus on machine learning and the use of theoretical guarantees, cs.LG is the most likely sub-category. However, the paper also touches on discrete optimization (cs.DS) and image analysis (cs.CV), which make those sub-categories likely as well. The use of decision trees and empirical evaluation further support the relevance to cs.AI and cs.CV.
